title: Exclusive interview: Paula Radcliffe defends her views - 'I have seen no evidence against any of Alberto Salazar's athletes'
text:
Ever since Paula Radcliffe suggested the US Anti-Doping Agency was “trying maybe to regain a little bit of face” by throwing Alberto Salazar out of athletics for four years, she has faced a torrid spell in the court of public opinion. There was an impression she was placing her corporate loyalties to Nike, which backed Salazar and his coaching methods at the now-moribund Nike Oregon Project, above her years of advocacy for clean sport. She was even drawn into a Twitter spat with Betsy Andreu, one of the whistle-blowers on Lance Armstrong’s doping and lies, who derided her as “Ms Lily White”.

Three weeks on, Radcliffe, far from reining in her remarks, is doubling down. “My views were based on...
description: Ever since Paula Radcliffe suggested the US Anti-Doping Agency was “trying maybe to regain a little bit of face” by throwing Alberto Salazar out of athletics for four years, she has faced a torrid spell in the court of public opinion.
